oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1958-09-13 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from September 13, 1958. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Ernest Tubb (host/performer - although Hawkshaw Hawkins was advertised as the host for this week on the previous show), guest performer Don Gibson, and regular performers the Jordanaires, Tommy Jackson, Chet Atkins, June Carter, and Grandpa Jones. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. It is announced that this is the 988th broadcast.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Ernest Tubb; Jordanaires; Don Gibson; Tommy Jackson; Chet Atkins; June Carter
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Grant Turner introduces Ernest Tubb -- Mississippi Gal (Ernest Tubb) -- Opening statement (Grant Turner, Ernest Tubb) -- Ernest Tubb introduces the Jordanaires -- In That Great Gettin' Up Morning (Jordanaires) -- Ernest Tubb introduces Don Gibson -- Look Who's Blue (Don Gibson, Jordanaires) -- Prince Albert commercial (Ernest Tubb, Grandpa Jones) -- Ernest Tubb introduces Tommy Jackson -- Katy Hill (Tommy Jackson fiddle) -- Ernest Tubb talks -- Stand By Me (Ernest Tubb) -- Ernest Tubb introduces Chet Atkins -- The Bells Of St. Mary's (Chet Atkins) -- Ernest Tubb introduces June Carter -- Comedy routine (June Carter, Ernest Tubb) [continued in part 2]
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); United States. Armed Forces Radio Service; Turner, Grant; Cash, June Carter, 1929-2003; Atkins, Chet; Jones, Grandpa, 1913-1998; Jackson, Tommy; Jordanaires (Musical group); Emmons, Buddy; Byrd, Billy; Tubb, Ernest, 1914-1984; Gibson, Don (Donald Eugene), 1928-2003
